cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi W of Cabo Cruz, Cuba and 100 mi S of Camagüey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across central-western Cuba Monday, then turning north-northwest through the Florida Straits and paralleling the west coast of Florida toward the Big Bend and the southeast United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast (likely Big Bend region between Tampa Bay and Cedar Key)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches presently confined to the Florida Keys, Florida Bay and the west coast of Florida from Flamingo to the Anclote River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings in effect for the Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas and portions of Cuba – none yet along Florida’s east coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impacts expected along Florida’s west coast and Keys, with secondary effects (rain bands, squalls) across the entire Florida peninsula including the east-central coast
weather_observation.wind: Bands of tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Tuesday night through Wednesday as Elsa passes west of the peninsula
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side; surge threat confined to Florida’s Gulf coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy squalls Tuesday–Wednesday with totals generally 2–4 inches, locally higher
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Tuesday into Wednesday associated with outer rain bands
